abstract: At $2.4 billion, Coca-Cola’s bid for the China Huiyuan Juice Company would been the largest takeover by a foreign company of a mainland Chinese firm.
snippet: At $2.4 billion, Coca-Cola’s bid for the China Huiyuan Juice Company would been the largest takeover by a foreign company of a mainland Chinese firm.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  China said on Wednesday that it had rejected a bid by the Coca-Cola Company to acquire one of the country’s biggest beverage makers for about $2.4 billion. The move blocked what would have been the biggest foreign takeover of a Chinese company and suggested Beijing was still uneasy with the idea of foreign ownership.

headline.main: China Blocks Coke Bid for Juice Maker
headline.print_headline: China Blocks Coke’s Bid for Juice Company
